intro: Clematis pseudoatragene, commonly known as the purple clematis, is a deciduous climbing vine native to China. It features palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of purple and blue. The plant has a woody stem with thorns and can grow up to 10 meters in length. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Clematis pseudoatragene is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
